[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Haha, that was a good one! Aren't you glad I pushed you into the cold water?
No, I'm not glad. That was completely uncalled for.
Oh come on, it was just a joke. Lighten up a bit.
It wasn't funny. You shouldn't push people like that, especially into cold water.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Desire to Hang Out More Often', 'Related Summaries': 'Neighbors A expresses a wish to spend more time together and suggests planning a movie night. Neighbors B agrees.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Neighbors A: Thanks, you always know how to make me feel better. And hey, speaking of clothes, I remember sitting in your armchair and taking off my jacket because it was so warm in here. ### Neighbors B: Haha, yeah. I always keep the heat up a bit too high, I guess. ### Neighbors A: It's okay, I love spending time in your cozy home. And speaking of spending time, can we hang out more often? I feel like we never get to see each other anymore. ### Neighbors B: Definitely, I would love that. We'll have to plan a movie night or something soon. ### Neighbors A: Sounds perfect. I can't wait!' }
```
